ErrorIndex.title: Wrapper for index information inside an error.

causeCollection.description:
A lower-level set of structured errors.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

causeIndexedCollection.description:
A lower-level set of structured errors.
Each of these errors MUST have index set.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

causeIsInternal.description: If true, then the cause (`causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection`) should be hidden from the user.

causeSimple.description:
Simple string error type.

Only oneOf `causeWrapped`, `causeSimple`, `causeCollection`, or `causeIndexedCollection` will ever be set.

code.description:
the numeric HTTP error code for the response.

Deprecated: Prefer to check the request's HTTP response code directly.

details.description:
The optional details of the error response.
Deprecated: Replaced by `causeSimple`.

dictionary.description:
Dictionary/map of associated data/information relevant to the error.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted
with information from this dictionary.

Deprecated: Use "values" instead.

domain.description:
The "domain" for the error.  If empty, it is an EDA
core error.  Alternatively it can be an EDA application
"apiVersion" value (e.g. interfaces.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1)
indicating that the error is specific to that application.
The domain gives the receiver information that they can use
to help them interpret the "type" field.

errors.description:
Collection of errors in cases where more than one exists.
This needs to be flexible so we can support multiple formats.
Deprecated: Replaced by `causeCollection` or `causeIndexedCollection` instead.

internal.description:
Internal error code number.

Deprecated: "type" & "domain" should be used instead to uniquely identify this error.

message.description: The basic text error message for the error response.

ref.description: Reference to the error source. Should typically be the URI of the request.

type.description:
Type defines a unique identifier for the error, within the domain.
This may be used (along with the domain) to find an internationalization translation for the message.

SHOULD be a valid golang identifier, and SHOULD be in UpperCamelCase.

values.description:
Associated data/information.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted with information from this dictionary.

Note that this map MUST NOT contain JSON objects (`{...}`) or arrays (`[...]`), only simple JSON types are permitted.

ErrorResponse.title: Generic error response for REST APIs.

Status.title: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.

com.nokia.eda.snow.v1alpha1.ClusterIncid.description: ClusterIncident is the Schema for the clusterincidents API

x-eda-nokia-com.ui-pattern-error: The apiVersion must be set to snow.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1
The kind must be set to ClusterIncident

spec.description: ClusterIncidentSpec defines the desired state of ClusterIncident

description.description: A short description of the Incident generator
description.title: Alarms

enabled.description: Indicates if the incident generator is enabled
enabled.title: Enabled

instance.description: Instances associated with this incident generator
instance.title: Instance

query.description: Include a query source in this incident generator

assignedTo.description: The individual assigned to resolve the incident (references the User table).
assignedTo.title: Assigned To

assignmentGroup.description: The group responsible for addressing the incident (references the Group table).
assignmentGroup.title: Assignment Group

autoResolve.description: If true this app will automatically resolve the incident when the object is deleted.
autoResolve.title: Auto Resolve

callerId.description: The user who reported the incident (references the User table).
callerId.title: Caller ID

category.description: General category of the incident (e.g., Software, Hardware, Network).
category.title: Category

closeCode.description: A code indicating how the incident was resolved (e.g., Solved (Workaround), Solved (Permanently)).
closeCode.title: Close Code

closeNotes.description: Notes on how the incident was resolved.
closeNotes.title: Close Notes

cmdbci.description:
The Configuration Item (CI) associated with the incident,
linking it to an asset or service in the CMDB (Configuration Management Database).
cmdbci.title: CMDBCI

customFields.description: List of custom fields to add to the incident

value.description: Custom field value, a Go template

customFields.title: Custom Fields

description.description: A detailed description of the issue.
description.title: Description

fields.description:
Fields to include in the subscribe results, which can then be used in the template,
e.g. '.namespace.node.name' or '.namespace.node.srl.interface.name"'.
fields.title: Fields

impact.description: Impact level on the organization, usually from 1 (highest) to 3 (lowest).
impact.title: Impact

location.description: Physical or logical location related to the incident.
location.title: Location

priority.description: Numeric priority of the incident, usually from 1 (highest) to 5 (lowest).
priority.title: Priority

resolutionCode.description: Indicates the type of resolution applied.
resolutionCode.title: Resolution Code

shortDescription.description:
A Go template used to generate a brief summary of the incident
when raising it in service now.
The template can use the fields from the subscription results.
e.g. 'Interface {{.node.srl.interface.name}} is down on node {{.node.name}}'.
shortDescription.title: Short Description

state.description:
The current status of the incident, typically represented by codes:
  1: New
  2: In Progress
  3: On Hold
  4: Resolved
  6: Closed
state.title: State

subCategory.description: More specific subcategory within the main category.
subCategory.title: Sub Category

table.description: EDB table to subscribe to. e.g. '.namespace.node.srl.interface'
table.title: Table

where.description: A where clause to use for the subscribe request, e.g: 'oper-state = down'. You can omit enclosing parentheses.
where.title: Where

query.title: Query

spec.title: Specification

status.description: ClusterIncidentStatus defines the observed state of ClusterIncident
status.title: Status

delete.description:
Delete all instances of ClusterIncident.  If ClusterIncident is a namespaced resource, all instances in all namespaces will
be deleted, and this is restricted to users with the system-administrator role.
If a non-namespaced ClusterIncident, it deletes all instances of that non-namespaced resource.

parameters.name: labelSelector

parameters.name: label-selector
